file_content.text: Nothing more I can do for you, Revanite. Feel free to wander the compound.
So you've finished the pilgrimage? Not bad.
I don't know what happened out there--it's none of my business--but the inner circle approves of your initiation.
How often do initiates fail?
Is that common?
Honestly? If you can survive the pilgrimage, you're probably a worthy initiate. But a lot of initiates don't survive at all.
Wonderful.
I'm only interested in meeting the Master.
I want your leader.
You're on your way. Take pride in that.
You did good in this trial. Now, you'll have to find someone else to show you the next stage of the journey.
Excellent. My initiation will be over soon.
Then I'm almost a Revanite.
Thank you.
If that's right, I have no more need for you.
I'm done here.
Good luck. Every step brings you closer to the Master.
The inner circle's waiting to meet you.
More initiates? Huh. The compound's getting less secure all the time.
Still, I suppose the Master knows what he's doing... and if you can follow the ways of Revan, we'll judge your worth.
What "ways" are you talking about?
"Ways of Revan"?
I hear you.
We'll see about that.
I'm not interested in being judged by my inferiors.
Your opinion is worthless.
Until you've proven yourself, you are nothing here. Remember that.
Revan didn't work alone. Revan had allies--all walks of life. We're no different.
You want to join us, you need to face the men and women who got here first and who've proved that they're loyal to the Master.
I'll strike down anyone who stands in my way.
They'll accept me or die.
That's a place to start.
I'm sure they'll find me an obedient student.
I'm happy to learn.
A reasonable security precaution.
That's sensible.
If that's the way you do business.
All right.
This isn't some formality. This is one of the trials of your initiation.
How does that work?
You're kidding.
Then maybe we shouldn't bother with you at all.
You need to show those in the Master's inner circle that you understand Revan's teachings. They'll ask questions. You'll answer.
If they're not satisfied, they'll abandon the tests of wisdom and begin to test your strength. Revan didn't suffer the weak.
I'd expect nothing less. I'll do what's needed.
Of course.
I'm glad to hear that.
How do I find them?
From what I've seen, weakness prevails among the Revanites.
Then Revan would hate you.
Then it's time you saw something more.
Your pilgrimage starts in the jungle--you'll find your first guide there. He'll determine whether you're worth sending on to the rest.
Be ready for anything, initiate. The jungle's dangerous, and so are the true Revanites.
Get out of here--you've got no business at the compound.
